member.summary: Sets to , to adjusted and to .

Path to the directory (file) that you want to associate with this object.

member.name: M:MdFilesMerger.Domain.Common.BaseDirectory.#ctor(System.Int32,System.String,System.DateTime)
member.summary: Sets all properties to values of appropriate arguments.
member.remarks: No evaluation or adjusting is performed, so use this method only for already evaluated and prepared data, for example from database.
member.param: Identification number of item.
Valid path to directory/file associated with this item. Path should use as directory separator.
Date and time of last modification of this entity.

member.name: P:MdFilesMerger.Domain.Common.BaseDirectory.ModifiedDate
member.value: By default it is set to .

member.name: M:MdFilesMerger.Domain.Common.BaseDirectory.CompareTo(MdFilesMerger.Domain.Abstract.IDirectory)
member.summary: Compares paths ( ) of the current instance and another object and returns integer indicating whether current instance precedes, follows or occurs in the same position in sort order as object.
member.remarks: After cutting off common part of both paths (common base directory), in sort order first occurs object without subdirectories. If both shortened paths (don't)have subdirectories they are sorted by names of the leased nested, not common, directory (file without extension) in almost lexical order. The difference is, that if both names are the same, except for the numerical postfixes, they are ordered numerically by values of this postfixes.

member.name: M:MdFilesMerger.Domain.Common.BaseDirectory.GetPath
member.summary: Gets directory/file path held in property.
member.returns: System specific valid path of this item.

member.name: M:MdFilesMerger.Domain.Common.BaseDirectory.SetPath(System.String)
member.summary: Sets as adjusted .
member.remarks: Checks if given is valid (doesn't contain any invalid path characters). If it is valid, sets as given using as directory separator character. Otherwise it sets to .
member.param: Valid absolute or relative path, that you want this directory(file) to have.

member.name: M:MdFilesMerger.Domain.Common.BaseDirectory.CompareDirectoriesNames(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Compare names of directories (files).
member.remarks: If names end with numbers check if names are the same except for numeric part. If yes extract numeric part and sort names by numeric order. Otherwise sort by ordinary lexical order.
member.param: Name of first directory (file).
Name of second directory (file).

list.item: 0 - if names ( and ) are the same

member.name: T:MdFilesMerger.Domain.Common.Hyperlinks
member.summary: Static class containing methods for hyperlinks management.

member.name: M:MdFilesMerger.Domain.Common.Hyperlinks.ContainsHyperlink(System.String)
member.summary: Determines whether the specified text contains hyperlink.
member.param: The text.
member.returns: if the specified text contains hyperlink; otherwise, .

member.name: M:MdFilesMerger.Domain.Common.Hyperlinks.GetLink(System.String)
member.summary: Gets the link part of the first hyperlink (underlying destination, where link points and directs to after clicking).
member.param: The text containing hyperlink.
member.returns: String with the link, if passed value contained hyperlink; otherwise .

member.name: M:MdFilesMerger.Domain.Common.Hyperlinks.GetText(System.String)
member.summary: Gets the text part of the first hyperlink (text that will be displayed as link).
member.param: The text containing hyperlink.
member.returns: String with the link description (visible text), if passed value contained hyperlink; otherwise .

member.name: M:MdFilesMerger.Domain.Common.Hyperlinks.HyperlinkToText(System.String)
member.summary: Converts the text containing hyperlink to the plain text.
member.remarks: The first hyperlink in the given text is replaced by its text part. The rest of the passed text stays the same.
member.param: The text containing hyperlink. For example header.
member.returns: The passed text with it's first hyperlink converted.

member.name: M:MdFilesMerger.Domain.Common.Hyperlinks.TextToHyperlink(System.String)
member.summary: Converts text to Markdown hyperlink leading to appropriate section of the file that it will be placed in.
member.remarks: The specified text is treated as text part of Markdown hyperlink. If text is a Markdown style header the leading '#' characters are previously removed. The text is also trimmed. Link leads to appropriate section of the file (that it will be place in). Name of the section is the same as the text.
member.param: The text to convert.
